title: pretty printers seem to not work with arm-none-eabi-gdb

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

body:
This works fine:

```
$file foo
foo: ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, (..)

$ rust-gdb -q foo
Reading symbols from foo...done.
(gdb) info pretty-printer
global pretty-printers:
  builtin
    mpx_bound128
  objfile /home/japaric/tmp/foo pretty-printers:
  rust_pretty_printer_lookup_function
```

Editing `rust-gdb` to call `arm-none-eabi-gdb` instead of `gdb`, however, doesn't register the
pretty printer:

```
$ file app
app: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, not stripped

$ sh -x ~/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin/rust-gdb -q app
+ set -e
++ rustc --print=sysroot
+ RUSTC_SYSROOT=/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+ GDB_PYTHON_MODULE_DIRECTORY=/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc
+ PYTHONPATH=:/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc
+ arm-none-eabi-gdb -d /home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc -iex 'add-auto-load-safe-path /home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc' -q app
Reading symbols from app...done.
(gdb) info pretty-printer
global pretty-printers:
  builtin
    mpx_bound128 
```

This works fine:

```
$file foo
foo: ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, (..)

$ rust-gdb -q foo
Reading symbols from foo...done.
(gdb) info pretty-printer
global pretty-printers:
  builtin
    mpx_bound128
  objfile /home/japaric/tmp/foo pretty-printers:
  rust_pretty_printer_lookup_function
```

Editing `rust-gdb` to call `arm-none-eabi-gdb` instead of `gdb`, however, doesn't register the
pretty printer:

```
$ file app
app: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, not stripped

$ sh -x ~/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin/rust-gdb -q app
+ set -e
++ rustc --print=sysroot
+ RUSTC_SYSROOT=/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+ GDB_PYTHON_MODULE_DIRECTORY=/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc
+ PYTHONPATH=:/home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc
+ arm-none-eabi-gdb -d /home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc -iex 'add-auto-load-safe-path /home/japaric/.multirust/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/etc' -q app
Reading symbols from app...done.
(gdb) info pretty-printer
global pretty-printers:
  builtin
    mpx_bound128 
```

Both files were compiled with debuginfo enabled (`-g`) and pretty much work fine under each debugger
but printing enums on `arm-none-eabi-gdb` results in not pretty output:

```
$ p foo
$1 = {{RUST$ENUM$DISR = B, c = 1 '\001'}, {RUST$ENUM$DISR = B}}
```

cc @michaelwoerister any tip about how to debug this further? Can I make the loading process verbose?
### Meta

```
$ rustc -V
rustc 1.13.0-nightly (55bf6a4f8 2016-09-18)

$ gdb -V
GNU gdb (GDB) 7.11.1
Copyright (C) 2016 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
and "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "x86_64-pc-linux-gnu".

$ arm-none-eabi-gdb -v
GNU gdb (GDB) 7.11.1
Copyright (C) 2016 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
and "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "--host=x86_64-pc-linux-gnu --target=arm-none-eabi".
```
